title: Block Print
subtitle: The Graceful Dance of Wood and Dye
description1: Using meticulously hand-carved wooden blocks, our master artisans create intricate patterns one precise impression at a time.
description2: This distinguished technique, dating back over 3,000 years, requires perfect precision and graceful, rhythmic movement.
checklist: Design lovingly carved on finest teakwood blocks
Natural dye carefully prepared with expertise
Precise hand-stamping on premium fabric
Expert fixing and gentle washing

title: Dabu Print
subtitle: The Ancient Art of Resist Dyeing
description1: Dabu printing is a treasured resist-dyeing technique originating from Rajasthan, where artisans use natural clay paste to create stunning patterns.
description2: This centuries-old method produces distinctive, organic designs with beautiful depth and character.
checklist: Natural clay paste (dabu) carefully prepared with gum and lime
Paste lovingly applied through hand-carved wooden blocks
Fabric gently dried in sunlight
Natural dye bath immersion creating resist patterns
Clay paste thoughtfully removed, revealing exquisite designs
Multiple dyeing layers for complex, rich patterns

title: Screen Print
subtitle: Precision Meets Artistic Expression
description1: Screen printing allows our skilled artisans to create beautifully consistent patterns with remarkable detail.
description2: While more modern than block printing, this technique still requires expert craftsmanship and an artist's discerning eye.
checklist: Design carefully transferred to fine mesh screens
Screens meticulously prepared with precision
Fabric positioned with exacting care
Dye expertly applied through screens using squeegees
Each color layer individually printed and dried
Quality inspection ensuring flawless results

title: Digital Print
subtitle: Modern Technology, Timeless Quality
description1: Digital printing brings contemporary design possibilities to traditional Indian textiles. While technology assisted, each piece is carefully monitored by our experienced artisans to ensure exceptional quality and color vibrancy.
checklist: Designs thoughtfully created or adapted digitally
Premium fabric carefully prepared for optimal ink absorption
Eco-friendly, AZO-free digital inks selected
Printing expertly supervised for color accuracy
Heat-setting process ensuring lasting vibrancy
Thorough quality inspection by experienced artisans

title: Chikan Embroidery
subtitle: The Poetry of White-on-White Elegance
description1: Chikan embroidery is one of India's most celebrated and delicate embroidery forms, originating from Lucknow.
description2: This exquisite hand-embroidery technique creates ethereal, lace-like patterns that speak of grace and refinement.
checklist: Design delicately traced on finest fabric
Multiple traditional stitches lovingly employed (bakhiya, tepchi, murri, phanda)
Each stitch carefully placed by skilled hands
Intricate motifs gradually taking shape
Final washing revealing the full beauty
Gentle pressing preserving the delicate work

stats.label: Time Investment
stats.value: 7-21 days per distinguished piece (depending on intricacy)

title: Chikan Embroidery (Computerized)
subtitle: Traditional Artistry Enhanced by Modern Precision
description1: Computerized Chikan embroidery honors traditional patterns while employing modern technology for consistency.
description2: Our artisans carefully program and supervise each piece, ensuring the soulful beauty of Chikan remains intact.
checklist: Traditional Chikan patterns thoughtfully digitized
Premium fabric carefully prepared and positioned
Computerized embroidery expertly supervised by trained artisans
Multiple passes creating layered depth
Hand-finishing touches added by skilled artisans
Thorough quality inspection ensuring authentic appearance

title: Machine Embroidery
subtitle: Precision Craftsmanship at Scale
description1: Machine embroidery allows us to create intricate, consistent patterns while maintaining our commitment to quality and artisan involvement.
description2: Each piece is carefully monitored and finished by skilled craftspeople.
checklist: Designs carefully created with artistic vision
Fabric thoughtfully prepared and stabilized
Premium threads selected for color and durability
Embroidery process expertly monitored by trained operators
Hand-finishing and thread trimming by skilled artisans
Comprehensive quality inspection

title: Machine Embroidery (Computerized)
subtitle: Digital Precision Guided by Artisan Expertise
description1: Computerized machine embroidery represents the perfect marriage of traditional design sensibility and modern precision.
description2: Our artisans carefully program, monitor, and finish each piece with expert care.
checklist: Traditional Indian motifs thoughtfully digitized
Advanced programming ensuring pattern integrity
Premium fabric precisely positioned in embroidery frames
Computerized stitching expertly supervised
Artisan hand-finishing adding human touch
Rigorous quality control by experienced craftspeople

title: Hand work (Gaderi / Kantha)
subtitle: The Meditative Art of Running Stitch Storytelling
description1: Kantha embroidery is a cherished folk art tradition, particularly treasured in Bengal and neighboring regions.
description2: This beautiful running stitch technique transforms simple fabric into textured masterpieces, each stitch a meditation.
checklist: Fabric layers carefully aligned and prepared
Designs lightly traced as gentle guides
Simple running stitches lovingly worked across entire surface
Patterns gradually emerging through rhythmic stitching
Multiple thread colors creating subtle dimension
Natural rippling texture developing organically

title: Applique work
subtitle: Layered Artistry in Fabric and Thread
description1: Appliqu√© work is the elegant art of layering fabric pieces onto a base textile, creating dimensional designs with remarkable visual impact.
description2: This technique combines cutting, positioning, and stitching expertise.
checklist: Design patterns carefully created and planned
Fabric pieces precisely cut in desired shapes
Base fabric thoughtfully prepared
Cut pieces strategically positioned and pinned
Edges expertly stitched (by hand or machine)
Additional embroidery embellishments added
Final pressing and finishing touches
